error.topup: Your topup failed for the following reason: {{reason}}

outboundPrivacy.label: Caller-ID Privacy
outboundPrivacy.tooltip: Determines what appears as Caller-ID for offnet outbound calls.

greetingsDialog.content: The step-by-step wizard will help familiarize you with your account settings so that you can begin setting up your business phone system. Your essential account information has been entered during registration.
greetingsDialog.title: Welcome to the platform

steps.1: Access your Account Settings by clicking on your name.
steps.2: Your Admin User settings can be viewed in the User tab. Individual settings such as Timezone, Language and Date & Time can be changed based on your preferences.
steps.3: Your Admin Account settings can be viewed in the Account tab. Here you can add a Technical Contact if you wish, and set Timezone & Language for the entire account.
steps.4: If you would like to update or change your credit card, please do so here. Please note that the credit card that you used during registration is currently on file in this tab.
steps.5: If you need/plan to make international calls, you will need to set up per-minute credits here.
steps.6: Review your current service plan and associated charges
steps.7: View all transactions made under your account, including all one-time fees and charges

endDialog.content: Now that you're familiarized with the different settings, you can take a few moments to change or update any of the information to fit your needs. When you're ready to begin setting up your phone system, close out of these settings by clicking the close button in the upper right or by simply clicking on your name again.
endDialog.title: Done!

user.passwordsNotMatching: The passwords you typed don't match

account.title: Account
account.postCidrSuccess: You successfully updated the access list.
account.accessListInvalid: Could not update access list, cannot contain invalid CIDRs
account.cidrsNotConfigured: Access list is currently not configured.
account.errorDuplicate: Could not update access list, please remove duplicate CIDRs
account.__comment: UI-966: Added common control to select carrier in myaccount

__comment: UI-2596: Adding format choices to phone numbers

numbersFormat.title: Phone Numbers Format
numbersFormat.help: By default, all phone numbers are displayed in their international standard (+1 415 222 3333 for a US number for instance), but you can also choose to display numbers in their national format ((415) 888-2222 for a US number). Finally you can choose to display all numbers in their international format, and then select countries that you wish to display in their national formats.

billing.title: Credit Card
billing.missingCard: Your credit card information is invalid, expired or missing - please update your credit card and save the changes.

trunks.title: Trunks
trunks.__comment: UI-664: Adding the real twoway sliders

example.inbound: EXAMPLE: 5 Inbound Trunks allow your platform to handle 5 simultaneous incoming calls
example.outbound: EXAMPLE: 10 Outbound Trunks allow your platform to handle 10 simultaneous calls to external numbers
example.twoway: EXAMPLE: 10 Two-way Trunks would allow your system to handle 6 inbound calls and 4 outbound calls at the same time.

help.inbound: The number of Inbound trunks defines how many simultaneous calls you can receive to your phone system.
help.outbound: The number of Outbound trunks defines how many concurrent external calls you can place at one time.
help.twoway: The number of Two-way trunks defines how many concurrent calls your platform can handle at one time.

trunks.saveSuccessMessage: The trunking limit has been updated successfully!

balance.title: Usage Charges
balance.payPerMinute: Pay-per-minute allows you to pay only for what you use. Deposit money into your account to get started, then pay-as-you-go for usage.
balance.invalidAmount: There is an error with the amount you typed! Please make sure to type a number using only digits '.' or ','
balance.autoRechargeEnabled: The Automatic Recharge of credits is now enabled!
balance.autoRechargeCancelled: You successfully cancelled the Automatic Recharge of your credits.
balance.creditsAdded: You successfully added {{amount}} to your balance!
balance.__comment: UI-1324: Adding the option to disable Braintree through a config flag
balance.disabledAddCreditTooltip: Braintree is required to perform this action. Please contact your administrator for more information.
balance.__comment: UI-1810: Implement new mock-up for 'Add Credits' popup with the ability to set Threshold Alerts

missingValue.title: Something seems to be missing!
missingValue.threshold_alerts_content: You've turned on Threshold Alerts, but it looks like you forgot to define the threshold amount. This is required in order for Threshold Alerts to take effect. Please either set a threshold amount, or turn off Threshold Alerts.
missingValue.auto_recharge_content: You've turned on Auto Recharge, but it looks like you forgot to define the Low balance threshold and/or Recharge Amount. These are both required in order for Auto Recharge to work. Please set the Threshold and/or Recharge Amount or turn Auto Recharge off.

manageCredits.text: Adding Credits Manually allows you to immediately increase your Current Balance. Maintaining a Current Balance is very important, as it is necessary for international or per-minute calls, e911, caller ID, and other system features that incur a charge.

thresholdAlerts.text: Threshold Alerts help you prevent shut off of services to your account by notifying you when your Current Balance gets low. It is strongly recommended to have Threshold Alerts turned on for your account.

labels.notifyMe: Notify me when balance falls below this amount

subscriptions.text1: On the 1st of each month, monthly subscription items will renew and you’ll be charged for the upcoming month.
subscriptions.text2: There are three ways you can cover these costs. Select how you’d like to be billed:
subscriptions.info: If you add any services mid-month, you’ll be charged immediately for the remainder of the month for that service. If you remove a service mid-month, you’ll be credited back for any unused portion of the month.

toast.success: Your billing method was updated successfully

preemptive.label: Use Account Credit, with Credit Card Backup
preemptive.text: Deduct my monthly service charges from my account balance. If my account dips below my automatic top-up threshold because of my monthly charge, use my credit card to cover any charges and return my account to my minimum top-up amount.

exact.label: Use Credit Card, with Account Credit as Backup
exact.text: Deduct my monthly subscription fees from my credit card in the exact amount of the monthly subscription. If my credit card is declined, any credit already on my account will serve as a backup to cover the charges until I’m able to fix my credit card issue.
exact.warning: This method requires you to always keep your account credit balance higher than your monthly subscription if you intend for your account credit to serve as a backup. If your account balance is lower than your subscription amount and your credit card declines, your account will be negative and services will fail. Please ensure your automatic top-up amount keeps you above the minimum threshold of your monthly bill.

none.label: Self-Manage
none.text: I’ll manage my credit balance and I’ll ensure there’s enough money for my monthly charges. This means I’ll add money to the account prior to the 1st of the month to cover any upcoming charges.
none.warning: If you are billed on the 1st and there is not enough money in your account, your services will stop working.

autoRecharge.text: Auto Recharge enables you to set up a threshold to automatically add credit, and determines how much will be refilled each time. Auto Recharge also will notify you via email when an account is recharged.

labels.balanceFalls: When balance falls below this amount
labels.rechargeAccount: Recharge this account with this amount

help.secondPart: Auto Recharge will only run once per day.
help.thirdPart: If the low balance threshold hits for the second time in one day and Auto Recharge has already occurred, you will receive an email notifying you that your account has reached the low balance threshold, however, the Account Admin must add more credit manually.
